page.title: 11Wootton Parish Council
page.content: Wootton is a large village of about 3000 inhabitants. The chairman of the Parish Council told us that they have a budget of Â£10000. About half of this is spent on street lighting. 20-25% goes on administration costs, and the rest is used to improve amenities in the village. Eleven Parish Councillors are elected every four years. Usually the election is not contested, it can be difficult to find people to serve. The Council meets on the first Tuesday of every month and the first twenty minutes are given up to listening to people's concerns. The Parish Council has had complaints about litter and hooliganism and has been asked to provide {sleeping policemen} in some roads to slow down the traffic. One of the Parish Council's main jobs is to present local needs to the District and County Councils.
